metadata.title: CVE-2017-9865 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
The function GfxImageColorMap::getGray in GfxState.cc in Poppler 0.54.0allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based bufferover-read and application crash) via a crafted PDF document, related tomissing color-map validation in ImageOutputDev.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
libpoppler73 - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.57.0-2ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: poppler package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.57.0-2ubuntu1').
